00002 /******************************************************************************/
00003 /* 
00004  *  This file is an amalgamation of all the individual source code files for
00005  *  Http Library 0.5.0.
00006  *
00007  *  Catenating all the source into a single file makes embedding simpler and
00008  *  the resulting application faster, as many compilers can do whole file
00009  *  optimization.
00010  *
00011  *  If you want to modify http, you can still get the whole source
00012  *  as individual files if you need.
00013  */
00014 
00015 
00016 /************************************************************************/
00017 /*
00018  *  Start of file "../src/include/http.h"
00019  */

00062 #if BLD_TUNE == MPR_TUNE_SIZE || DOXYGEN
00063     /*  
00064         Tune for size
00065      */
00066     #define HTTP_BUFSIZE              (4 * 1024)            /**< Default I/O buffer size */
00067     #define HTTP_CONN_MEM             ((16 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD) /**< Virt memory per connection */
00068     #define HTTP_REC_MEM              ((1 * 1024 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD) /**< Initial virt memory arena size */
00069     #define HTTP_MAX_BODY             (64 * 1024)           /**< Maximum incoming request content body size */
00070     #define HTTP_MAX_CHUNK            (8 * 1024)            /**< Max chunk size for transfer chunk encoding */
00071     #define HTTP_MAX_HEADERS          2048                  /**< Max size of the headers */
00072     #define HTTP_MAX_IOVEC            16                    /**< Number of fragments in a single socket write */
00073     #define HTTP_MAX_NUM_HEADERS      20                    /**< Max number of header lines */
00074     #define HTTP_MAX_REQUESTS         20                    /**< Max concurrent requests */
00075     #define HTTP_MAX_RESPONSE_BODY    (128 * 1024 * 1024)   /**< Max buffer for response data */
00076     #define HTTP_MAX_STAGE_BUFFER     (4 * 1024)            /**< Max buffer for any stage */
00077     #define HTTP_MAX_UPLOAD           (10 * 1024 * 1024)    /* Max size of uploaded document */
00078 
00079 #elif BLD_TUNE == MPR_TUNE_BALANCED
00080     /*  
00081         Tune balancing speed and size
00082      */
00083     #define HTTP_BUFSIZE              (4 * 1024)
00084     #define HTTP_CONN_MEM             ((32 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD)
00085     #define HTTP_REC_MEM              ((2 * 1024 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD)
00086     #define HTTP_MAX_BODY             (1024 * 1024)
00087     #define HTTP_MAX_CHUNK            (8 * 1024)
00088     #define HTTP_MAX_HEADERS          (8 * 1024)
00089     #define HTTP_MAX_IOVEC            24
00090     #define HTTP_MAX_NUM_HEADERS      40
00091     #define HTTP_MAX_REQUESTS         50
00092     #define HTTP_MAX_RESPONSE_BODY    (256 * 1024 * 1024)
00093     #define HTTP_MAX_STAGE_BUFFER     (32 * 1024)
00094     #define HTTP_MAX_UPLOAD           0x7fffffff
00095 
00096 #else
00097     /*  
00098         Tune for speed
00099      */
00100     #define HTTP_BUFSIZE              (8 * 1024)
00101     #define HTTP_CONN_MEM             ((64 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD)
00102     #define HTTP_REC_MEM              ((4 * 1024 * 1024) - MPR_HEAP_OVERHEAD)
00103     #define HTTP_MAX_BODY             (1024 * 1024)
00104     #define HTTP_MAX_CHUNK            (8 * 1024) 
00105     #define HTTP_MAX_HEADERS          (8 * 1024)
00106     #define HTTP_MAX_IOVEC            32
00107     #define HTTP_MAX_NUM_HEADERS      256
00108     #define HTTP_MAX_REQUESTS         1000
00109     #define HTTP_MAX_RESPONSE_BODY    0x7fffffff
00110     #define HTTP_MAX_STAGE_BUFFER     (64 * 1024)
00111     #define HTTP_MAX_UPLOAD           0x7fffffff
00112 #endif

00119 #define HTTP_MAX_SECRET           128               /**< Size of secret data for SSL */
00120 #define HTTP_MAX_KEEP_ALIVE       100               /**< Maximum requests per connection */
00121 #define HTTP_PACKET_ALIGN(x)      (((x) + 0x3FF) & ~0x3FF)
00122 #define HTTP_RANGE_BUFSIZE        128               /**< Size of a range boundary */
00123 #define HTTP_RETRIES              3                 /**< Default number of retries for client requests */

00187 /** 
00188     Http service object
00189     The Http service is managed by a single service object.
00190     @stability Evolving
00191     @defgroup Http Http
00192     @see Http HttpConn HttpServer httpCreate httpCreateSecret httpGetContext httpGetDateString httpSetContext
00193     httpSetDefaultHost httpSetDefaultPort httpSetProxy
00194  */
00195 typedef struct Http {
00196     struct HttpLimits *limits;              /**< Pointer to http->limits */
00197     MprList         *connections;           /**< Currently open connection requests */
00198     MprHashTable    *stages;                /**< Possible stages in connection pipelines */
00199     MprHashTable    *mimeTypes;             /**< Mime Types */
00200     MprHashTable    *statusCodes;           /**< Http status codes */
00201 
00202     /*  
00203         Some standard pipeline stages
00204      */
00205     struct HttpStage *netConnector;         /**< Default network connector */
00206     struct HttpStage *sendConnector;        /**< Optimized sendfile connector */
00207     struct HttpStage *authFilter;           /**< Authorization filter (digest and basic) */
00208     struct HttpStage *rangeFilter;          /**< Ranged requests filter */
00209     struct HttpStage *chunkFilter;          /**< Chunked transfer encoding filter */
00210     struct HttpStage *dirHandler;           /**< Directory listing handler */
00211     struct HttpStage *egiHandler;           /**< Embedded Gateway Interface (EGI) handler */
00212     struct HttpStage *ejsHandler;           /**< Ejscript Web Framework handler */
00213     struct HttpStage *fileHandler;          /**< Static file handler */
00214     struct HttpStage *passHandler;          /**< Pass through handler */
00215 
00216     MprEvent        *timer;                 /**< Admin service timer */
00217     MprTime         now;                    /**< When was the currentDate last computed */
00218     MprMutex        *mutex;
00219     HttpGetPassword getPassword;            /**< Lookup password callback */
00220     HttpValidateCred validateCred;          /**< Validate user credentials callback */
00221 
00222     void            *context;               /**< Embedding context */
00223     char            *currentDate;           /**< Date string for HTTP response headers */
00224     char            *expiresDate;           /**< Convenient expiry date (1 day in advance) */
00225     char            *secret;                /**< Random bytes for authentication */
00226     char            *defaultHost;           /**< Default ip address */
00227     int             defaultPort;            /**< Default port */
00228     char            *proxyHost;             /**< Proxy ip address */
00229     int             proxyPort;              /**< Proxy port */
00230     int             keepAliveTimeout;       /**< Default timeout for keep-alive */
00231     int             maxKeepAlive;           /**< Default maximum keep-alive count */
00232     int             sslLoaded;              /**< True when the SSL provider has been loaded */
00233     int             timeout;                /**< Default time a request can take */
00234 
00235     void            (*rangeService)(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpRangeProc fill);
00236 } Http;
00237 
00238 /**
00239     Create a Http connection object
00240     @description Create a new http connection object. This creates an object that can be initialized and then
00241         used with mprHttpRequest. Destroy with mprFree.
00242     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00243     @return A newly allocated HttpConn structure. Caller must free using mprFree.
00244     @ingroup Http
00245  */
00246 extern Http *httpCreate(MprCtx ctx);

00248 /**
00249     Create a Http client
00250     @param http HttpConn object created via $httpCreateConn
00251     @param dispatcher Dispatcher to use. Can be null.
00252     @return Returns a HttpConn connection object
00253  */
00254 extern struct HttpConn *httpCreateClient(Http *http, MprDispatcher *dispatcher);

00258     @description Create http secret data that is used to seed SSL based communications.

00262  */
00263 extern int httpCreateSecret(Http *http);

00270 extern void *httpGetContext(Http *http);

00272 /**
00273     Get the time as an ISO date string
00274     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00275     @param sbuf Optional path buffer. If supplied, the modified time of the path is used. If NULL, then the current
00276         time is used.
00277     @return RFC822 formatted date string. Caller must free.
00278  */
00279 extern char *httpGetDateString(MprCtx ctx, MprPath *sbuf);

00321 /** 
00322     Http limits
00323     @stability Evolving
00324     @defgroup HttpLimits HttpLimits
00325     @see HttpLimits
00326  */
00327 typedef struct HttpLimits {
00328     int             maxBody;                /**< Max size of an incoming request */
00329     int             maxChunkSize;           /**< Max chunk size for transfer encoding */
00330     int             maxHeader;              /**< Max size of the total header */
00331     int             maxNumHeaders;          /**< Max number of lines of header */
00332     int             maxResponseBody;        /**< Max size of generated response content */
00333     int             maxRequests;            /**< Maximum number of concurrent requests */
00334     int             maxStageBuffer;         /**< Max buffering by any pipeline stage */
00335     int             maxThreads;             /**< Max number of pool threads */
00336     int             minThreads;             /**< Min number of pool threads */
00337     int             maxUploadSize;          /**< Max size of an uploaded file */
00338     int             maxUri;                 /**< Max size of a uri */
00339     int             threadStackSize;        /**< Stack size for each pool thread */
00340 } HttpLimits;

00342 /** 
00343     URI management
00344     @description The HTTP provides routines for formatting and parsing URIs. Routines are also provided
00345         to escape dangerous characters for URIs as well as HTML content and shell commands.
00346     @stability Evolving
00347     @see HttpConn, httpCreateUri, httpCreateUriFromParts, httpFormatUri, httpEscapeCmd, httpEscapeHtml, httpUrlEncode, 
00348         httpUrlDecode, httpValidateUri, httpLookupMimeType
00349     @defgroup HttpUri HttpUri
00350  */
00351 typedef struct HttpUri {
00352     /*  
00353         These are pointers into the parsedUriBuf.
00354      */
00355     char        *scheme;                /**< URI scheme (http|https|...) */
00356     char        *host;                  /**< Host name */
00357     char        *path;                  /**< Uri path (without scheme, host, query or fragements) */
00358     char        *ext;                   /**< Document extension */
00359     char        *reference;             /**< Reference fragment within the specified resource */
00360     char        *query;                 /**< Query string */
00361     int         port;                   /**< Port number */
00362     int         flags;                  /** Flags */
00363     int         secure;                 /** Using https */
00364 
00365     char        *originalUri;           /**< Original URI (not decoded) */
00366     char        *parsedUriBuf;          /**< Allocated storage for parsed uri */
00367 } HttpUri;
00368 
00369 /*  
00370     Character escaping masks
00371  */
00372 #define HTTP_ESCAPE_HTML            0x1
00373 #define HTTP_ESCAPE_SHELL           0x2
00374 #define HTTP_ESCAPE_URL             0x4
00375 
00376 /** 
00377     Create and initialize a URI.
00378     @description Parse a uri and return a tokenized HttpUri structure.
00379     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00380     @param uri Uri string to parse
00381     @param complete Add missing components. ie. Add scheme, host and port if not supplied. 
00382     @return A newly allocated HttpUri structure. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00383     @ingroup HttpUri
00384  */
00385 extern HttpUri *httpCreateUri(MprCtx ctx, cchar *uri, int complete);
00386 
00387 /** 
00388     Format a URI
00389     @description Format a URI string using the input components.
00390     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00391     @param scheme Protocol string for the uri. Example: "http"
00392     @param host Host or IP address
00393     @param port TCP/IP port number
00394     @param path URL path
00395     @param ref URL reference fragment
00396     @param query Additiona query parameters.
00397     @param complete Add missing elements. For example, if scheme is null, then add "http".
00398     @return A newly allocated uri string. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00399     @ingroup HttpUri
00400  */
00401 extern char *httpFormatUri(MprCtx ctx, cchar *scheme, cchar *host, int port, cchar *path, cchar *ref, cchar *query, 
00402         int complete);
00403 
00404 extern HttpUri *httpCreateUriFromParts(MprCtx ctx, cchar *scheme, cchar *host, int port, cchar *path, cchar *reference, 
00405         cchar *query);
00406 
00407 /** 
00408     Encode a string escaping typical command (shell) characters
00409     @description Encode a string escaping all dangerous characters that have meaning for the unix or MS-DOS command shells.
00410     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00411     @param cmd Command string to encode
00412     @param escChar Escape character to use when encoding the command.
00413     @return An allocated string containing the escaped command. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00414     @ingroup HttpUri
00415  */
00416 extern char *httpEscapeCmd(MprCtx ctx, cchar *cmd, int escChar);
00417 
00418 /**
00419     Encode a string by escaping typical HTML characters
00420     @description Encode a string escaping all dangerous characters that have meaning in HTML documents
00421     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00422     @param html HTML content to encode
00423     @return An allocated string containing the escaped HTML. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00424     @ingroup HttpUri
00425  */
00426 extern char *httpEscapeHtml(MprCtx ctx, cchar *html);
00427 
00428 /** 
00429     Get the mime type for an extension.
00430     This call will return the mime type from a limited internal set of mime types for the given path or extension.
00431     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00432     @param ext Path or extension to examine
00433     @returns Mime type. This is a static string. Caller must not free.
00434  */
00435 extern cchar *httpLookupMimeType(MprCtx ctx, cchar *ext);
00436 
00437 /** 
00438     Encode a string by escaping URL characters
00439     @description Encode a string escaping all characters that have meaning for URLs.
00440     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00441     @param url URL to encode
00442     @return An allocated string containing the encoded URL. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00443     @ingroup HttpUri
00444  */
00445 extern char *httpUrlEncode(MprCtx ctx, cchar *url);
00446 
00447 /** 
00448     Decode a URL string by de-scaping URL characters
00449     @description Decode a string with www-encoded characters that have meaning for URLs.
00450     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00451     @param url URL to decode
00452     @return A reference to the buf argument.
00453     @ingroup HttpUri
00454  */
00455 extern char *httpUrlDecode(MprCtx ctx, cchar *url);
00456 
00457 /** 
00458     Convert a Uri to a string.
00459     @description Convert the given Uri to a string, optionally completing missing parts such as the host, port and path.
00460     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00461     @param uri A Uri object created via httpCreateUri 
00462     @param complete Fill in missing parts of the uri
00463     @return A newly allocated uri string. Caller must free using $mprFree.
00464     @ingroup HttpUri
00465  */
00466 extern char *httpUriToString(MprCtx ctx, HttpUri *uri, int complete);
00467 
00468 /** 
00469     Validate a URL
00470     @description Validate and canonicalize a URL. This removes redundant "./" sequences and simplifies "../dir" 
00471         references. This operates in-situ and modifies the existing string.
00472     @param ctx Any memory allocation context created by MprAlloc
00473     @param url Uri string to validate
00474     @return A validated url.
00475     @ingroup HttpUri
00476  */
00477 extern char *httpValidateUri(MprCtx ctx, char *url);
00478 
00479 /** 
00480     Content range structure
00481     @pre
00482         Range:  0,  49  First 50 bytes
00483         Range: -1, -50  Last 50 bytes
00484         Range:  1,  -1  Skip first byte then select content to the end
00485     @stability Evolving
00486     @defgroup HttpRange HttpRange
00487     @see HttpRange
00488  */
00489 typedef struct HttpRange {
00490     MprOffset           start;                  /**< Start of range */
00491     MprOffset           end;                    /**< End byte of range + 1 */
00492     int                 len;                    /**< Redundant range length */
00493     struct HttpRange    *next;                  /**< Next range */
00494 } HttpRange;
00495 
00496 /*  
00497     Packet flags
00498  */
00499 #define HTTP_PACKET_HEADER    0x1               /**< Packet contains HTTP headers */
00500 #define HTTP_PACKET_RANGE     0x2               /**< Packet is a range boundary packet */
00501 #define HTTP_PACKET_DATA      0x4               /**< Packet contains actual content data */
00502 #define HTTP_PACKET_END       0x8               /**< End of stream packet */
00503 
00504 /** 
00505     Packet object. 
00506     @description The request/response pipeline sends data and control information in HttpPacket objects. The output
00507         stream typically consists of a HEADER packet followed by zero or more data packets and terminated by an END
00508         packet. If the request has input data, the input stream is consists of one or more data packets followed by
00509         an END packet.
00510         \n\n
00511         Packets contain data and optional prefix or suffix headers. Packets can be split, joined, filled or emptied. 
00512         The pipeline stages will fill or transform packet data as required.
00513     @stability Evolving
00514     @defgroup HttpPacket HttpPacket
00515     @see HttpPacket HttpQueue httpCreatePacket, httpCreateConnPacket httpCreateDataPacket httpCreateEndPacket 
00516         httpFreePacket httpJoinPacket httpSplitPacket httpGetPacketLength httpCreateHeaderPacket httpGetPacket
00517         httpJoinPacketForService httpPutForService httpIsPacketTooBig httpSendPacket httpPutBackPacket 
00518         httpPutForService httpSendPacketToNext httpResizePacket
00519  */
00520 typedef struct HttpPacket {
00521     MprBuf          *prefix;                /**< Prefix message to be emitted before the content */
00522     MprBuf          *content;               /**< Chunk content */
00523     MprBuf          *suffix;                /**< Prefix message to be emitted after the content */
00524     int             flags;                  /**< Packet flags */
00525     int             entityLength;           /**< Entity length. Content is null. */
00526     struct HttpPacket *next;                /**< Next packet in chain */
00527 } HttpPacket;
00528 
00529 
00530 /** 
00531     Create a data packet
00532     @description Create a packet of the required size.
00533     @param ctx A conn or request memory context object.
00534     @param size Size of the package data storage.
00535     @return HttpPacket object.
00536     @ingroup HttpPacket
00537  */
00538 extern HttpPacket *httpCreatePacket(MprCtx ctx, int size);
00539 
00540 /**
00541     Create a connection packet packet
00542     @description Create a packet of the required size that is owned by the connection
00543     @param conn HttpConn connection object
00544     @param size Size of the package data storage.
00545     @return HttpPacket object.
00546 */
00547 extern HttpPacket *httpCreateConnPacket(struct HttpConn *conn, int size);
00548 
00549 /** 
00550     Free a packet. This recycles a packet for rapid reuse
00551     @param q Queue reference
00552     @param packet Packet to free
00553  */
00554 extern void httpFreePacket(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00555 
00556 /** 
00557     Create a data packet
00558     @description Create a packet and set the HTTP_PACKET_DATA flag
00559         Data packets convey data through the response pipeline.
00560     @param ctx A conn or request memory context object.
00561     @param size Size of the package data storage.
00562     @return HttpPacket object.
00563     @ingroup HttpPacket
00564  */
00565 extern HttpPacket *httpCreateDataPacket(MprCtx ctx, int size);
00566 
00567 /** 
00568     Create an eof packet
00569     @description Create an end-of-stream packet and set the HTTP_PACKET_END flag. The end pack signifies the 
00570         end of data. It is used on both incoming and outgoing streams through the request/response pipeline.
00571     @param ctx A conn or request memory context object.
00572     @return HttpPacket object.
00573     @ingroup HttpPacket
00574  */
00575 extern HttpPacket *httpCreateEndPacket(MprCtx ctx);
00576 
00577 /** 
00578     Create a response header packet
00579     @description Create a response header packet and set the HTTP_PACKET_HEADER flag. 
00580         A header packet is used by the pipeline to hold the response headers.
00581     @param ctx A conn or request memory context object.
00582     @return HttpPacket object.
00583     @ingroup HttpPacket
00584  */
00585 extern HttpPacket *httpCreateHeaderPacket(MprCtx ctx);
00586 
00587 /** 
00588     Join two packets
00589     @description Join the contents of one packet to another by copying the data from the \a other packet into 
00590         the first packet. 
00591     @param packet Destination packet
00592     @param other Other packet to copy data from.
00593     @return Zero if successful, otherwise a negative Mpr error code
00594     @ingroup HttpPacket
00595  */
00596 extern int httpJoinPacket(HttpPacket *packet, HttpPacket *other);
00597 
00598 /** 
00599     Split a data packet
00600     @description Split a data packet at the specified offset. Packets may need to be split so that downstream
00601         stages can digest their contents. If a packet is too large for the queue maximum size, it should be split.
00602         When the packet is split, a new packet is created containing the data after the offset. Any suffix headers
00603         are moved to the new packet.
00604     @param conn HttpConn connection object
00605     @param packet Packet to split
00606     @param offset Location in the original packet at which to split
00607     @return New HttpPacket object containing the data after the offset. No need to free, unless you have a very long
00608         running request. Otherwise the packet memory will be released automatically when the request completes.
00609     @ingroup HttpPacket
00610  */
00611 extern HttpPacket *httpSplitPacket(struct HttpConn *conn, HttpPacket *packet, int offset);
00612 
00613 #if DOXYGEN
00614 /** 
00615     Get the length of the packet data contents
00616     @description Get the content length of a packet. This does not include the prefix or suffix data length -- just
00617         the pure data contents.
00618     @param packet Packet to examine.
00619     @return Count of bytes contained by the packet.
00620     @ingroup HttpPacket
00621  */
00622 extern int httpGetPacketLength(HttpPacket *packet);
00623 #else
00624 #define httpGetPacketLength(p) (p->content ? mprGetBufLength(p->content) : p->entityLength)
00625 #endif
00626 
00627 /** 
00628     Get the next packet from a queue
00629     @description Get the next packet. This will remove the packet from the queue and adjust the queue counts
00630         accordingly. If the queue was full and upstream queues were blocked, they will be enabled.
00631     @param q Queue reference
00632     @return The packet removed from the queue.
00633     @ingroup HttpQueue
00634  */
00635 extern HttpPacket *httpGetPacket(struct HttpQueue *q);
00636 
00637 /** 
00638     Join a packet onto the service queue
00639     @description Add a packet to the service queue. If the queue already has data, then this packet
00640         will be joined (aggregated) into the existing packet. If serviceQ is true, the queue will be scheduled
00641         for service.
00642     @param q Queue reference
00643     @param packet Packet to join to the queue
00644     @param serviceQ If true, schedule the queue for service
00645     @ingroup HttpQueue
00646  */
00647 extern void httpJoinPacketForService(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet, bool serviceQ);
00648 
00649 /** 
00650     Put a packet onto the service queue
00651     @description Add a packet to the service queue. If serviceQ is true, the queue will be scheduled for service.
00652     @param q Queue reference
00653     @param packet Packet to join to the queue
00654     @param serviceQ If true, schedule the queue for service
00655     @ingroup HttpQueue
00656  */
00657 extern void httpPutForService(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet, bool serviceQ);
00658 
00659 
00660 /** 
00661     Test if a packet is too big 
00662     @description Test if a packet is too big to fit downstream. If the packet content exceeds the downstream queue's 
00663         maximum or exceeds the downstream queue's requested packet size -- then this routine will return true.
00664     @param q Queue reference
00665     @param packet Packet to test
00666     @return True if the packet is too big for the downstream queue
00667     @ingroup HttpQueue
00668  */
00669 extern bool httpIsPacketTooBig(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00670 
00671 /** 
00672     Put a packet onto a queue
00673     @description Put the packet onto the end of queue by calling the queue's put() method. 
00674     @param q Queue reference
00675     @param packet Packet to put
00676     @ingroup HttpQueue
00677  */
00678 extern void httpSendPacket(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00679 
00680 /** 
00681     Put a packet back onto a queue
00682     @description Put the packet back onto the front of the queue. The queue's put() method is not called.
00683         This is typically used by the queue's service routine when a packet cannot complete processing.
00684     @param q Queue reference
00685     @param packet Packet to put back
00686     @ingroup HttpQueue
00687  */
00688 extern void httpPutBackPacket(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00689 
00690 /** 
00691     Put a packet onto a service queue
00692     @description Put the packet onto the service queue and optionally schedule the queue for service.
00693     @param q Queue reference
00694     @param packet Packet to put
00695     @ingroup HttpQueue
00696  */
00697 extern void httpPutForService(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet, bool serviceQ);
00698 
00699 /** 
00700     Put a packet onto the next queue
00701     @description Put a packet onto the next downstream queue by calling the downstreams queue's put() method. 
00702     @param q Queue reference. The packet will not be queued on this queue, but rather on the queue downstream.
00703     @param packet Packet to put
00704     @ingroup HttpQueue
00705  */
00706 extern void httpSendPacketToNext(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00707 
00708 /** 
00709     Resize a packet
00710     @description Resize a packet if required so that it fits in the downstream queue. This may split the packet
00711         if it is too big to fit in the downstream queue. If it is split, the tail portion is put back on the queue.
00712     @param q Queue reference
00713     @param packet Packet to put
00714     @param size If size is > 0, then also ensure the packet is not larger than this size.
00715     @return Zero if successful, otherwise a negative Mpr error code
00716     @ingroup HttpQueue
00717  */
00718 extern int httpResizePacket(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet, int size);
00719 
00720 /*  
00721     Queue directions
00722  */
00723 #define HTTP_QUEUE_TRANS          0           /**< Send (transmit to client) queue */
00724 #define HTTP_QUEUE_RECEIVE        1           /**< Receive (read from client) queue */
00725 #define HTTP_MAX_QUEUE            2           /**< Number of queue types */
00726 
00727 /* 
00728    Queue flags
00729  */
00730 #define HTTP_QUEUE_OPEN           0x1         /**< Queue's open routine has been called */
00731 #define HTTP_QUEUE_DISABLED       0x2         /**< Queue's service routine is disabled */
00732 #define HTTP_QUEUE_FULL           0x4         /**< Queue is full */
00733 #define HTTP_QUEUE_ALL            0x8         /**< Queue has all the data there is and will be */
00734 #define HTTP_QUEUE_SERVICED       0x10        /**< Queue has been serviced at least once */
00735 #define HTTP_QUEUE_EOF            0x20        /**< Queue at end of data */
00736 
00737 /*  
00738     Queue callback prototypes
00739  */
00740 typedef void (*HttpQueueOpen)(struct HttpQueue *q);
00741 typedef void (*HttpQueueClose)(struct HttpQueue *q);
00742 typedef void (*HttpQueueData)(struct HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00743 typedef void (*HttpQueueService)(struct HttpQueue *q);
00744 
00745 /** 
00746     Queue object
00747     @description The request pipeline consists of a full-duplex pipeline of stages. Each stage has two queues,
00748         one for outgoing data and one for incoming. A HttpQueue object manages the data flow for a request stage
00749         and has the ability to queue and process data, manage flow control and schedule packets for service.
00750         \n\n
00751         Queue's provide open, close, put and service methods. These methods manage and respond to incoming packets.
00752         A queue can respond immediately to an incoming packet by processing or dispatching a packet in its put() method.
00753         Alternatively, the queue can defer processing by queueing the packet on it's service queue and then waiting for
00754         it's service() method to be invoked. 
00755         \n\n
00756         If a queue does not define a put() method, the default put method will 
00757         be used which queues data onto the service queue. The default incoming put() method joins incoming packets
00758         into a single packet on the service queue.
00759     @stability Evolving
00760     @defgroup HttpQueue HttpQueue
00761     @see HttpQueue HttpPacket HttpConn httpDiscardData httpGet httpJoinPacketForService httpPutForService httpDefaultPut 
00762         httpDisableQueue httpEnableQueue httpGetQueueRoom httpIsQueueEmpty httpIsPacketTooBig httpPut httpPutBack 
00763         httpPutForService httpPutNext httpRemoveQueue httpResizePacket httpScheduleQueue httpSendPacket httpSendPackets 
00764         httpSendEndPacket httpServiceQueue httpWillNextQueueAccept httpWrite httpWriteBlock httpWriteBody httpWriteString
00765  */
00766 typedef struct HttpQueue {
00767     cchar               *owner;                 /**< Name of owning stage */
00768     struct HttpStage    *stage;                 /**< Stage owning this queue */
00769     struct HttpConn     *conn;                  /**< Connection ownning this queue */
00770     HttpQueueOpen       open;                   /**< Open the queue */
00771     HttpQueueClose      close;                  /**< Close the queue */
00772     HttpQueueData       put;                    /**< Put a message on the queue */
00773     HttpQueueService    service;                /**< Service the queue */
00774     struct HttpQueue    *nextQ;                 /**< Downstream queue for next stage */
00775     struct HttpQueue    *prevQ;                 /**< Upstream queue for prior stage */
00776     struct HttpQueue    *scheduleNext;          /**< Next linkage when queue is on the service queue */
00777     struct HttpQueue    *schedulePrev;          /**< Previous linkage when queue is on the service queue */
00778     struct HttpQueue    *pair;                  /**< Queue for the same stage in the opposite direction */
00779     HttpPacket          *first;                 /**< First packet in queue (singly linked) */
00780     HttpPacket          *last;                  /**< Last packet in queue (tail pointer) */
00781     int                 count;                  /**< Bytes in queue */
00782     int                 max;                    /**< Maxiumum queue size */
00783     int                 low;                    /**< Low water mark for flow control */
00784     int                 flags;                  /**< Queue flags */
00785     int                 packetSize;             /**< Maximum acceptable packet size */
00786     int                 direction;              /**< Flow direction */
00787     void                *queueData;             /**< Stage instance data */
00788 
00789     /*  
00790         Connector instance data. Put here to save a memory allocation.
00791      */
00792     MprIOVec            iovec[HTTP_MAX_IOVEC];
00793     int                 ioIndex;                /**< Next index into iovec */
00794     int                 ioCount;                /**< Count of bytes in iovec */
00795     int                 ioFileEntry;            /**< Has file entry in iovec */
00796     int                 ioFileOffset;           /**< The next file position to use */
00797 } HttpQueue;
00798 
00799 
00800 //  TODO -- rationalize with mprCleanQueue
00801 /** 
00802     Discard all data from the queue
00803     @description Discard data from the queue. If removePackets (not yet implemented) is true, then remove the packets
00804         otherwise, just discard the data and preserve the packets.
00805     @param q Queue reference
00806     @param removePackets If true, the data packets will be removed from the queue
00807     @ingroup HttpQueue
00808  */
00809 extern void httpDiscardData(HttpQueue *q, bool removePackets);
00810 
00811 /** 
00812     Disable a queue
00813     @description Mark a queue as disabled so that it will not be scheduled for service.
00814     @param q Queue reference
00815     @ingroup HttpQueue
00816  */
00817 extern void httpDisableQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00818 
00819 /** 
00820     Enable a queue
00821     @description Enable a queue for service and schedule it to run. This will cause the service routine
00822         to run as soon as possible.
00823     @param q Queue reference
00824     @ingroup HttpQueue
00825  */
00826 extern void httpEnableQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00827 
00828 /** 
00829     Get the room in the queue
00830     @description Get the amount of data the queue can accept before being full.
00831     @param q Queue reference
00832     @return A count of bytes that can be written to the queue
00833     @ingroup HttpQueue
00834  */
00835 extern int httpGetQueueRoom(HttpQueue *q);
00836 
00837 /** 
00838     Determine if the queue is empty
00839     @description Determine if the queue has no packets queued. This does not test if the queue has no data content.
00840     @param q Queue reference
00841     @return True if there are no packets queued.
00842     @ingroup HttpQueue
00843  */
00844 extern bool httpIsQueueEmpty(HttpQueue *q);
00845 
00846 /** 
00847     Open the queue. Call the queue open entry point.
00848     @param q Queue reference
00849     @param chunkSize Preferred chunk size
00850  */
00851 extern void httpOpenQueue(HttpQueue *q, int chunkSize);
00852 
00853 /** 
00854     Remove a queue
00855     @description Remove a queue from the request/response pipeline. This will remove a queue so that it does
00856         not participate in the pipeline, effectively removing the processing stage from the pipeline. This is
00857         useful to remove unwanted filters and to speed up pipeline processing
00858     @param q Queue reference
00859     @ingroup HttpQueue
00860  */
00861 extern void httpRemoveQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00862 
00863 /** 
00864     Schedule a queue
00865     @description Schedule a queue by adding it to the schedule queue. Queues are serviced FIFO.
00866     @param q Queue reference
00867     @ingroup HttpQueue
00868  */
00869 extern void httpScheduleQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00870 
00871 /** 
00872     Send all queued packets
00873     @description Send all queued packets downstream
00874     @param q Queue reference
00875     @ingroup HttpQueue
00876  */
00877 extern void httpSendPackets(HttpQueue *q);
00878 
00879 /** 
00880     Send an end packet
00881     @description Create and send an end-of-stream packet downstream
00882     @param q Queue reference
00883     @ingroup HttpQueue
00884  */
00885 extern void httpSendEndPacket(HttpQueue *q);
00886 
00887 /** 
00888     Service a queue
00889     @description Service a queue by invoking its service() routine. 
00890     @param q Queue reference
00891     @ingroup HttpQueue
00892  */
00893 extern void httpServiceQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00894 
00895 /** 
00896     Determine if the downstream queue will accept this packet.
00897     @description Test if the downstream queue will accept a packet. The packet will be resized if required in an
00898         attempt to get the downstream queue to accept it. If the downstream queue is full, disable this queue
00899         and mark the downstream queue as full and service it immediately to try to relieve the congestion.
00900     @param q Queue reference
00901     @param packet Packet to put
00902     @return True if the downstream queue will accept the packet. Use $httpSendPacketToNext to send the packet downstream
00903     @ingroup HttpQueue
00904  */
00905 extern bool httpWillNextQueueAcceptPacket(HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
00906 
00907 /** 
00908     Write a formatted string
00909     @description Write a formatted string of data into packets onto the end of the queue. Data packets will be created
00910         as required to store the write data. This call may block waiting for the downstream queue to drain if it is 
00911         or becomes full.
00912     @param q Queue reference
00913     @param fmt Printf style formatted string
00914     @param ... Arguments for fmt
00915     @return A count of the bytes actually written
00916     @ingroup HttpQueue
00917  */
00918 extern int httpWrite(HttpQueue *q, cchar *fmt, ...);
00919 
00920 /** 
00921     Write a block of data to the queue
00922     @description Write a block of data into packets onto the end of the queue. Data packets will be created
00923         as required to store the write data.
00924     @param q Queue reference
00925     @param buf Buffer containing the write data
00926     @param size of the data in buf
00927     @param block Set to true to block and wait for data to drain if the downstream queue is full. If false, the
00928         call may return not having written all the data. The return value indicates how many bytes were actually written.
00929     @return A count of the bytes actually written
00930     @ingroup HttpQueue
00931  */
00932 extern int httpWriteBlock(HttpQueue *q, cchar *buf, int size, bool block);
00933 
00934 /** 
00935     Write a string of data to the queue
00936     @description Write a string of data into packets onto the end of the queue. Data packets will be created
00937         as required to store the write data. This call may block waiting for the downstream queue to drain if it is 
00938         or becomes full.
00939     @param q Queue reference
00940     @param s String containing the data to write
00941     @return A count of the bytes actually written
00942     @ingroup HttpQueue
00943  */
00944 extern int httpWriteString(HttpQueue *q, cchar *s);
00945 
00946 //TODO - merge httpCleanQueue with httpDiscardData
00947 /* Internal */
00948 extern void httpCleanQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00949 extern HttpQueue *httpFindPreviousQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00950 extern bool httpDrainQueue(HttpQueue *q, bool block);
00951 extern HttpQueue *httpCreateQueue(struct HttpConn *conn, struct HttpStage *stage, int direction, HttpQueue *prev);
00952 extern HttpQueue *httpGetNextQueueForService(HttpQueue *q);
00953 extern void httpInitQueue(struct HttpConn *conn, HttpQueue *q, cchar *name);
00954 extern void httpInitSchedulerQueue(HttpQueue *q);
00955 extern void httpInsertQueue(HttpQueue *prev, HttpQueue *q);
00956 extern int httpIsEof(struct HttpConn *conn);
00957 
00958 /*
00959     The Http processing pipeline is comprised of a sequence of "stages". 
00960     Stage Flags. Use request method flags as-is so we can quickly validate methods for stages.
00961  */
00962 #define HTTP_STAGE_DELETE         HTTP_DELETE       /**< Support DELETE requests */
00963 #define HTTP_STAGE_GET            HTTP_GET          /**< Support GET requests */
00964 #define HTTP_STAGE_HEAD           HTTP_HEAD         /**< Support HEAD requests */
00965 #define HTTP_STAGE_OPTIONS        HTTP_OPTIONS      /**< Support OPTIONS requests */
00966 #define HTTP_STAGE_POST           HTTP_POST         /**< Support POST requests */
00967 #define HTTP_STAGE_PUT            HTTP_PUT          /**< Support PUT requests */
00968 #define HTTP_STAGE_TRACE          HTTP_TRACE        /**< Support TRACE requests */
00969 #define HTTP_STAGE_ALL            HTTP_METHOD_MASK  /**< Mask for all methods */
00970 
00971 #define HTTP_STAGE_CONNECTOR      0x1000            /**< Stage is a connector  */
00972 #define HTTP_STAGE_HANDLER        0x2000            /**< Stage is a handler  */
00973 #define HTTP_STAGE_FILTER         0x4000            /**< Stage is a filter  */
00974 #define HTTP_STAGE_MODULE         0x8000            /**< Stage is a filter  */
00975 #define HTTP_STAGE_VARS           0x10000           /**< Create query and form variables table */
00976 #define HTTP_STAGE_ENV_VARS       0x20000           /**< Create CGI style environment variables table */
00977 #define HTTP_STAGE_VIRTUAL        0x40000           /**< Handler serves virtual resources not the physical file system */
00978 #define HTTP_STAGE_PATH_INFO      0x80000           /**< Always do path info processing */
00979 #define HTTP_STAGE_AUTO_DIR       0x100000          /**< Want auto directory redirection */
00980 #define HTTP_STAGE_VERIFY_ENTITY  0x200000          /**< Verify the request entity exists */
00981 
00982 #define HTTP_STAGE_INCOMING       0x400000
00983 #define HTTP_STAGE_OUTGOING       0x800000
00984 
00985 typedef int (*HttpParse)(Http *http, cchar *key, char *value, void *state);
00986 
00987 /** 
00988     Pipeline Stages
00989     @description The request pipeline consists of a full-duplex pipeline of stages. 
00990         Stages are used to process client HTTP requests in a modular fashion. Each stage either creates, filters or
00991         consumes data packets. The HttpStage structure describes the stage capabilities and callbacks.
00992         Each stage has two queues, one for outgoing data and one for incoming data.
00993         \n\n
00994         Stages provide callback methods for parsing configuration, matching requests, open/close, run and the
00995         acceptance and service of incoming and outgoing data.
00996     @stability Evolving
00997     @defgroup HttpStage HttpStage 
00998     @see HttpStage HttpQueue HttpConn httpCreateConnector httpCreateFilter httpCreateHandler httpDefaultOutgoingServiceStage
00999         httpLookupStageData
01000  */
01001 typedef struct HttpStage {
01002     char            *name;                  /**< Stage name */
01003     int             flags;                  /**< Stage flags */
01004     void            *stageData;             /**< Private stage data */
01005     MprHashTable    *extensions;            /**< Matching extensions for this filter */
01006 
01007     /** 
01008         Match a request
01009         @description This method is invoked to see if the stage wishes to handle the request. If a stage denies to
01010             handle a request, it will be removed from the pipeline.
01011         @param conn HttpConn connection object
01012         @param stage Stage object
01013         @param uri Current request URI
01014         @return True if the stage wishes to process this request.
01015         @ingroup HttpStage
01016      */
01017     bool (*match)(struct HttpConn *conn, struct HttpStage *stage, cchar *uri);
01018 
01019     /** 
01020         Open the queue
01021         @description Open the queue instance and initialize for this request.
01022         @param q Queue instance object
01023         @ingroup HttpStage
01024      */
01025     void (*open)(HttpQueue *q);
01026 
01027     /** 
01028         Close the queue
01029         @description Close the queue instance
01030         @param q Queue instance object
01031         @ingroup HttpStage
01032      */
01033     void (*close)(HttpQueue *q);
01034 
01035     /** 
01036         Run the queue
01037         @description The queue is run after all incoming data has been received.
01038         @param q Queue instance object
01039         @ingroup HttpStage
01040      */
01041     void (*run)(HttpQueue *q);
01042 
01043     /** 
01044         Process outgoing data.
01045         @description Accept a packet as outgoing data
01046         @param q Queue instance object
01047         @param packet Packet of data
01048         @ingroup HttpStage
01049      */
01050     void (*outgoingData)(HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
01051 
01052     /** 
01053         Service the outgoing data queue
01054         @param q Queue instance object
01055         @ingroup HttpStage
01056      */
01057     void (*outgoingService)(HttpQueue *q);
01058 
01059     /** 
01060         Process incoming data.
01061         @description Accept an incoming packet of data
01062         @param q Queue instance object
01063         @param packet Packet of data
01064         @ingroup HttpStage
01065      */
01066     void (*incomingData)(HttpQueue *q, HttpPacket *packet);
01067 
01068     /** 
01069         Service the incoming data queue
01070         @param q Queue instance object
01071         @ingroup HttpStage
01072      */
01073     void (*incomingService)(HttpQueue *q);
01074 
01075     /** 
01076         Parse configuration data.
01077         @description This is invoked when parsing appweb configuration files
01078         @param http Http object
01079         @param key Configuration directive name
01080         @param value Configuration directive value
01081         @param state Current configuration parsing state
01082         @return Zero if the key was not relevant to this stage. Return 1 if the directive applies to this stage and
01083             was accepted.
01084         @ingroup HttpStage
01085      */
01086     int (*parse)(Http *http, cchar *key, char *value, void *state);
01087 
01088 } HttpStage;
01089 
01090 
01091 /** 
01092     Create a connector stage
01093     @description Create a new stage.
01094     @param http Http object returned from #httpCreate
01095     @param name Name of connector stage
01096     @param flags Stage flags mask. These specify what Http request methods will be supported by this stage. Or together
01097         any of the following flags:
01098         @li HTTP_STAGE_HANDLER    - Stage is a handler DELETE requests
01099         @li HTTP_STAGE_FILTER     - Stage is a filter
01100         @li HTTP_STAGE_CONNECTOR  - Stage is a connector
01101         @li HTTP_STAGE_GET        - Support GET requests
01102         @li HTTP_STAGE_HEAD       - Support HEAD requests
01103         @li HTTP_STAGE_OPTIONS    - Support OPTIONS requests
01104         @li HTTP_STAGE_POST       - Support POST requests
01105         @li HTTP_STAGE_PUT        - Support PUT requests
01106         @li HTTP_STAGE_TRACE      - Support TRACE requests
01107         @li HTTP_STAGE_ALL        - Mask to support all methods
01108     @return A new stage object
01109     @ingroup HttpStage
01110  */
01111 extern HttpStage *httpCreateStage(Http *http, cchar *name, int flags);
01112 
01113 /**
01114     Create a clone of an existing state. This is used when creating filters configured to match certain extensions.
01115     @param http Http object returned from #httpCreate
01116     @param stage Stage object to clone
01117     @return A new stage object
01118     @ingroup HttpStage
01119 */
01120 extern HttpStage *httpCloneStage(Http *http, HttpStage *stage);
01121 
01122 /** 
01123     Lookup a stage by name
01124     @param http Http object
01125     @param name Name of stage to locate
01126     @return Stage or NULL if not found
01127     @ingroup HttpStage
01128 */
01129 extern struct HttpStage *httpLookupStage(Http *http, cchar *name);
01130 
01131 /** 
01132     Create a connector stage
01133     @description Create a new connector. Connectors are the final stage for outgoing data. Their job is to transmit
01134         outgoing data to the client.
01135     @param http Http object returned from #httpCreate
01136     @param name Name of connector stage
01137     @param flags Stage flags mask. These specify what Http request methods will be supported by this stage. Or together
01138         any of the following flags:
01139         @li HTTP_STAGE_DELETE     - Support DELETE requests
01140         @li HTTP_STAGE_GET        - Support GET requests
01141         @li HTTP_STAGE_HEAD       - Support HEAD requests
01142         @li HTTP_STAGE_OPTIONS    - Support OPTIONS requests
01143         @li HTTP_STAGE_POST       - Support POST requests
01144         @li HTTP_STAGE_PUT        - Support PUT requests
01145         @li HTTP_STAGE_TRACE      - Support TRACE requests
01146         @li HTTP_STAGE_ALL        - Mask to support all methods
01147     @return A new stage object
01148     @ingroup HttpStage
01149  */
01150 extern HttpStage *httpCreateConnector(Http *http, cchar *name, int flags);
01151 
01152 /** 
01153     Create a filter stage
01154     @description Create a new filter. Filters transform data generated by handlers and before connectors transmit to
01155         the client. Filters can apply transformations to incoming, outgoing or bi-directional data.
01156     @param http Http object
01157     @param name Name of connector stage
01158     @param flags Stage flags mask. These specify what Http request methods will be supported by this stage. Or together
01159         any of the following flags:
01160         @li HTTP_STAGE_DELETE     - Support DELETE requests
01161         @li HTTP_STAGE_GET        - Support GET requests
01162         @li HTTP_STAGE_HEAD       - Support HEAD requests
01163         @li HTTP_STAGE_OPTIONS    - Support OPTIONS requests
01164         @li HTTP_STAGE_POST       - Support POST requests
01165         @li HTTP_STAGE_PUT        - Support PUT requests
01166         @li HTTP_STAGE_TRACE      - Support TRACE requests
01167         @li HTTP_STAGE_ALL        - Mask to support all methods
01168     @return A new stage object
01169     @ingroup HttpStage
01170  */
01171 extern HttpStage *httpCreateFilter(Http *http, cchar *name, int flags);
01172 
01173 /** 
01174     Create a request handler stage
01175     @description Create a new handler. Handlers generate outgoing data and are the final stage for incoming data. 
01176         Their job is to process requests and send outgoing data downstream toward the client consumer.
01177         There is ever only one handler for a request.
01178     @param http Http object
01179     @param name Name of connector stage
01180     @param flags Stage flags mask. These specify what Http request methods will be supported by this stage. Or together
01181         any of the following flags:
01182         @li HTTP_STAGE_DELETE     - Support DELETE requests
01183         @li HTTP_STAGE_GET        - Support GET requests
01184         @li HTTP_STAGE_HEAD       - Support HEAD requests
01185         @li HTTP_STAGE_OPTIONS    - Support OPTIONS requests
01186         @li HTTP_STAGE_POST       - Support POST requests
01187         @li HTTP_STAGE_PUT        - Support PUT requests
01188         @li HTTP_STAGE_TRACE      - Support TRACE requests
01189         @li HTTP_STAGE_ALL        - Mask to support all methods
01190     @return A new stage object
01191     @ingroup HttpStage
01192  */
01193 extern HttpStage *httpCreateHandler(Http *http, cchar *name, int flags);
01194 
01195 /** 
01196     Default outgoing data handling
01197     @description This routine provides default handling of outgoing data for stages. It simply sends all packets
01198         downstream.
01199     @param q Queue object
01200     @ingroup HttpStage
01201  */
01202 extern void httpDefaultOutgoingServiceStage(HttpQueue *q);
01203 
01204 /** 
01205     Lookup stage data
01206     @description This looks up the stage by name and returns the private stage data.
01207     @param http Http object
01208     @param name Name of the stage concerned
01209     @return Reference to the stage data block.
01210     @ingroup HttpStage
01211  */
01212 extern void *httpLookupStageData(Http *http, cchar *name);
01213 
01214 /* Internal APIs */
01215 extern void httpRegisterStage(Http *http, HttpStage *stage);
01216 extern int httpOpenNetConnector(Http *http);
01217 extern int httpOpenAuthFilter(Http *http);
01218 extern int httpOpenChunkFilter(Http *http);
01219 extern int httpOpenRangeFilter(Http *http);
01220 extern int httpOpenUploadFilter(Http *http);
01221 
01222 /* 
01223     Connection flags
01224  */
01225 #define HTTP_CONN_PIPE_CREATED      0x1     /**< Request pipeline created */
01226 #define HTTP_CONN_TRACE             0x2     /**< Enable the use of TRACE */
01227 
01228 /** 
01229     Notification flags
01230  */
01231 #define HTTP_NOTIFY_READABLE        0x1     /**< The request has data available for reading */
01232 #define HTTP_NOTIFY_WRITABLE        0x2     /**< The request is now writable (post / put data) */
01233 
01234 /*  
01235     Connection / Request states
01236  */
01237 #define HTTP_STATE_BEGIN            1       /**< Ready for a new request */
01238 #define HTTP_STATE_STARTED          2       /**< A new request has started */
01239 #define HTTP_STATE_WAIT             3       /**< Waiting for the response */
01240 #define HTTP_STATE_PARSED           4       /**< Headers have been parsed */
01241 #define HTTP_STATE_CONTENT          5       /**< Reading posted content */
01242 #define HTTP_STATE_CONTENT_RECEIVED 6       /**< All content has been received */
01243 #define HTTP_STATE_PROCESSING       7       /**< Request handler is processing */
01244 #define HTTP_STATE_REDIRECT         8       /**< Redirected response */
01245 #define HTTP_STATE_ERROR            9       /**< Request in error */
01246 #define HTTP_STATE_CONN_ERROR       10      /**< Connection error */
01247 #define HTTP_STATE_COMPLETE         11      /**< Request complete */
01248 #define HTTP_STATE_DESTROY          12      /**< Destroy a connection */
01249 
01250 /** 
01251     Notifier and event callbacks.
01252  */
01253 typedef int  (*HttpCallback)(void *arg, MprEvent *event);
01254 
01255 /** 
01256     Http Connections
01257     @description The HttpConn object represents a TCP/IP connection to the client. A connection object is created for
01258         each socket connection initiated by the client. One HttpConn object may service many Http requests due to 
01259         HTTP/1.1 keep-alive.
01260     @stability Evolving
01261     @defgroup HttpConn HttpConn
01262     @see HttpConn HttpReceiver HttpReceiver HttpTransmitter HttpQueue HttpStage
01263         httpCreateConn httpCloseConn httpCompleteRequest httpCreatePipeline httpDestroyPipeline httpDiscardPipeline
01264         httpError httpGetAsync httpGetConnContext httpGetError httpGetKeepAliveCount httpPrepConn httpRunPipeline
01265         httpScheduleClose httpServiceQueues httpSetAsync httpSetCredentials httpSetCallback httpSetConnContext
01266         httpSetConnNotifier httpSetKeepAliveCount httpSetProtocol httpSetRetries httpSetState httpSetTimeout
01267         httpWritable
01268  */
01269 typedef struct HttpConn {
01270     Http            *http;                  /**< Http service object  */
01271     HttpCallback    callback;               /**< Http I/O event callback */
01272     void            *callbackArg;
01273     HttpLimits      *limits;                /**< Service limits */
01274     MprHashTable    *stages;                /**< Stages in pipeline */
01275     MprDispatcher   *dispatcher;            /**< Event dispatcher */
01276     HttpNotifier    notifier;               /**< Http state change notification callback */
01277     MprWaitHandler  waitHandler;            /**< I/O wait handler */
01278     struct HttpServer *server;              /**< Server object (if releveant) */
01279     MprSocket       *sock;                  /**< Underlying socket handle */
01280 
01281     struct HttpReceiver *receiver;          /**< Receiver object */
01282     struct HttpTransmitter *transmitter;    /**< Transmitter object */
01283     struct HttpQueue serviceq;              /**< List of queues that require service for request pipeline */
01284 
01285     HttpPacket      *input;                 /**< Header packet */
01286     HttpPacket      *freePackets;           /**< Free list of packets */
01287     HttpQueue       *readq;                 /**< End of the read pipeline */
01288     HttpQueue       *writeq;                /**< Start of the write pipeline */
01289     MprTime         started;                /**< When the connection started */
01290     MprTime         expire;                 /**< When the connection should expire */
01291     MprTime         time;                   /**< Cached current time */
01292     void            *context;               /**< Embedding context */
01293     char            *boundary;              /**< File upload boundary */
01294     char            *errorMessage;          /**< Error message for the last request (if any) */
01295     char            *ip;                    /**< Remote client IP address */
01296     cchar           *protocol;              /**< HTTP protocol */
01297     int             async;                  /**< Connection is in async mode (non-blocking) */
01298     int             followRedirects;        /**< Follow redirects for client requests */
01299     int             keepAliveCount;         /**< Count of remaining keep alive requests for this connection */
01300     int             legacy;                 /**< Using legacy HTTP/1.0 */
01301     int             port;                   /**< Remote port */
01302     int             retries;                /**< Client request retries */
01303     int             secure;                 /**< Using https */
01304     int             timeout;                /**< Timeout period in msec */
01305     int             state;                  /**< Connection state */
01306     int             flags;                  /**< Connection flags */
01307     int             canProceed;             /**< State machine should continue to process the request */
01308 
01309     /*  
01310         Authentication for client requests
01311      */
01312     char            *authCnonce;            /**< Digest authentication cnonce value */
01313     char            *authDomain;            /**< Authentication domain */
01314     char            *authNonce;             /**< Nonce value used in digest authentication */
01315     int             authNc;                 /**< Digest authentication nc value */
01316     char            *authOpaque;            /**< Opaque value used to calculate digest session */
01317     char            *authRealm;             /**< Authentication realm */
01318     char            *authQop;               /**< Digest authentication qop value */
01319     char            *authType;              /**< Basic or Digest */
01320     char            *authGroup;             /**< Group name credentials for authorized client requests */
01321     char            *authUser;              /**< User name credentials for authorized client requests */
01322     char            *authPassword;          /**< Password credentials for authorized client requests */
01323     int             sentCredentials;        /**< Sent authorization credentials */
01324 } HttpConn;
01325

01360 /** 
01361     Create a connection object
01362     Most interactions with the Http library are via a connection object. It is used for server-side communications when
01363     responding to client requests and it is used to initiate outbound client requests.

01366     @param dispatcher Dispatcher to use. Can be null.

01425 /** 
01426     Get the count of Keep-Alive requests that will be used for this connection object.
01427     @description Http keep alive means that the TCP/IP connection is preserved accross multiple requests. This
01428         typically means much higher performance and better response. Http keep alive is enabled by default 
01429         for Http/1.1 (the default). Disable keep alive when talking to old, broken HTTP servers.
01430     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01431     @return The maximum count of keep alive requests. 
01432     @ingroup HttpConn
01433  */
01434 extern int httpGetKeepAliveCount(HttpConn *conn);

01505 /** 
01506     Control Http Keep-Alive for the connection.
01507     @description Http keep alive means that the TCP/IP connection is preserved accross multiple requests. This
01508         typically means much higher performance and better response. Http keep alive is enabled by default 
01509         for Http/1.1 (the default). Disable keep alive when talking to old, broken HTTP servers.
01510     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01511     @param count Count of keep alive transactions to use before closing the connection. Set to zero to disable keep-alive.
01512     @ingroup HttpConn
01513  */
01514 extern void httpSetKeepAliveCount(HttpConn *conn, int count);
01515

01521         must be persistent.
01522     Use HTTP/1.1 wherever possible.
01523     @ingroup HttpConn
01524  */
01525 extern void httpSetProtocol(HttpConn *conn, cchar *protocol);
01526 
01527 /** 
01528     Set the Http retry count
01529     @description Define the number of retries before failing a request. It is normative for network errors
01530         to require that requests be sometimes retried. The default retries is set to (2).

01532     @param retries Count of retries
01533     @ingroup HttpConn
01534  */
01535 extern void httpSetRetries(HttpConn *conn, int retries);

01592 /** 
01593     Authorization
01594     HttpAuth is the foundation authorization object and is used as base class by HttpDirectory and HttpLocation.
01595     It stores the authorization configuration information required to determine if a client request should be permitted 
01596     access to a given resource.
01597     @stability Evolving
01598     @defgroup HttpAuth HttpAuth
01599     @see HttpAuth
01600  */
01601 typedef struct HttpAuth {
01602     bool            anyValidUser;           /**< If any valid user will do */
01603     int             type;                   /**< Kind of authorization */
01604 
01605     char            *allow;                 /**< Clients to allow */
01606     char            *deny;                  /**< Clients to deny */
01607     char            *requiredRealm;         /**< Realm to use for access */
01608     char            *requiredGroups;        /**< Auth group for access */
01609     char            *requiredUsers;         /**< User name for access */
01610     HttpAcl         requiredAcl;            /**< ACL for access */
01611 
01612     int             backend;                /**< Authorization method (PAM | FILE) */
01613     int             flags;                  /**< Auth flags */
01614     int             order;                  /**< Order deny/allow, allow/deny */
01615     char            *qop;                   /**< Digest Qop */
01616 
01617 #if BLD_FEATURE_AUTH_FILE
01618     /*  
01619         State for file based authorization
01620      */
01621     char            *userFile;              /**< User name auth file */
01622     char            *groupFile;             /**< Group auth file  */
01623     MprHashTable    *users;                 /**< Hash of user file  */
01624     MprHashTable    *groups;                /**< Hash of group file  */
01625 #endif
01626 } HttpAuth;

01716 /* 
01717     Receiver flags
01718  */
01719 #define HTTP_DELETE             0x1         /**< DELETE method  */
01720 #define HTTP_GET                0x2         /**< GET method  */
01721 #define HTTP_HEAD               0x4         /**< HEAD method  */
01722 #define HTTP_OPTIONS            0x8         /**< OPTIONS method  */
01723 #define HTTP_POST               0x10        /**< Post method */
01724 #define HTTP_PUT                0x20        /**< PUT method  */
01725 #define HTTP_TRACE              0x40        /**< TRACE method  */
01726 #define HTTP_METHOD_MASK        0x7F        /**< Method mask */
01727 #define HTTP_REC_CREATE_ENV     0x80        /**< Must create env for this request */
01728 #define HTTP_REC_IF_MODIFIED    0x100       /**< If-[un]modified-since supplied */
01729 #define HTTP_REC_CHUNKED        0x200       /**< Content is chunk encoded */
01730 
01731 /*  
01732     Incoming chunk encoding states
01733  */
01734 #define HTTP_CHUNK_START      1             /**< Start of a new chunk */
01735 #define HTTP_CHUNK_DATA       2             /**< Start of chunk data */
01736 #define HTTP_CHUNK_EOF        3             /**< End of last chunk */
01737 
01738 /** 
01739     Http Receiver
01740     @description Most of the APIs in the receiver group still take a HttpConn object as their first parameter. This is
01741         to make the API easier to remember - APIs take a connection object rather than a receiver or transmitter object.
01742     @stability Evolving
01743     @defgroup HttpReceiver HttpReceiver
01744     @see HttpReceiver HttpConn HttpTransmitter httpWriteBlocked httpGetCookies httpGetQueryString
01745  */
01746 typedef struct HttpReceiver {
01747     MprHeap         *arena;                 /**< Memory arena */
01748     HttpConn        *conn;                  /**< Connection object */
01749     HttpPacket      *packet;                /**< Current input packet */
01750     HttpPacket      *headerPacket;          /**< HTTP headers */
01751     HttpUri         *parsedUri;             /**< Parsed request url */
01752     HttpLocation    *location;              /**< Location block */
01753     MprList         *inputPipeline;         /**< Input processing */
01754     MprHashTable    *headers;               /**< Header variables */
01755     MprList         *etags;                 /**< Document etag to uniquely identify the document version */
01756     MprTime         since;                  /**< If-Modified date */
01757 
01758     char            *method;                /**< Request method */
01759     char            *url;                   /**< Url request path (Decoded) */
01760     char            *scriptName;            /**< ScriptName portion of the url (Decoded) */
01761     char            *pathInfo;              /**< Extra path information (Decoded) */
01762     char            *pathTranslated;        /**< Mapped pathInfo to storage (Decoded) */
01763 
01764     int             length;                 /**< Declared content length (ENV: CONTENT_LENGTH) */
01765     int             chunkState;             /**< Chunk encoding state */
01766     int             chunkSize;              /**< Size of the next chunk */
01767     int             chunkRemainingData;     /**< Remaining chunk data to read */
01768     int             flags;                  /**< Receiver modifiers */
01769     int             needInputPipeline;      /**< Input pipeline required to process received data */
01770     int             remainingContent;       /**< Remaining content data to read */
01771     int             receivedContent;        /**< Length of content actually received */
01772     int             readContent;            /**< Length of content read by user */
01773 
01774     bool            ifModified;             /**< If-Modified processing requested */
01775     bool            ifMatch;                /**< If-Match processing requested */
01776 
01777     /*  
01778         Incoming response line if a client request 
01779      */
01780     int             status;                 /**< HTTP response status */
01781     char            *statusMessage;         /**< HTTP Response status message */
01782 
01783     /* 
01784         Header values
01785      */
01786     char            *accept;                /**< Accept header */
01787     char            *acceptCharset;         /**< Accept-Charset header */
01788     char            *acceptEncoding;        /**< Accept-Encoding header */
01789     char            *cookie;                /**< Cookie header */
01790     char            *connection;            /**< Connection header */
01791     char            *contentLengthStr;      /**< Content length string value */
01792     char            *forwarded;             /**< Forwarded header */
01793     char            *hostName;              /**< Client supplied host name */
01794     char            *pragma;                /**< Pragma header */
01795     char            *mimeType;              /**< Mime type of the request payload (ENV: CONTENT_TYPE) */
01796     char            *redirect;              /**< Redirect location header */
01797     char            *referer;               /**< Refering URL */
01798     char            *userAgent;             /**< User-Agent header */
01799 
01800     MprHashTable    *formVars;              /**< Query and post data variables */
01801     HttpRange       *ranges;                /**< Data ranges for body data */
01802     HttpRange       *inputRange;            /**< Specified range for input (post) data */
01803 
01804     /*  
01805         Auth details
01806      */
01807     HttpAuth        *auth;                  /**< Auth object */
01808     char            *authAlgorithm;
01809     char            *authDetails;
01810     char            *authStale;             
01811     char            *authType;              /**< Authorization type (basic|digest) (ENV: AUTH_TYPE) */
01812 
01813     /*  
01814         Upload details
01815      */
01816     MprHashTable    *files;                 /**< Uploaded files. Managed by the upload filter */
01817     char            *uploadDir;             /**< Upload directory */
01818     int             autoDelete;             /**< Auto delete uploaded files */
01819 
01820     /*
01821         Extensions for Appweb. Inline for performance.
01822      */
01823     struct MaAlias  *alias;                 /**< Matching alias */
01824     struct MaDir    *dir;                   /**< Best matching dir (PTR only) */
01825 } HttpReceiver;
01826 
01827 
01828 /** 
01829     Get a receiver content length
01830     @description Get the length of the receiver body content (if any). This is used in servers to get the length of posted
01831         data and in clients to get the response body length.
01832     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01833     @return A count of the response content data in bytes.
01834     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01835  */
01836 extern int httpGetContentLength(HttpConn *conn);
01837 
01838 /** 
01839     Get the request cookies
01840     @description Get the cookies defined in the current requeset
01841     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01842     @return Return a string containing the cookies sent in the Http header of the last request
01843     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01844  */
01845 extern cchar *httpGetCookies(HttpConn *conn);
01846 
01847 /** 
01848     Get a receiver http header.
01849     @description Get a http response header for a given header key.
01850     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01851     @param key Name of the header to retrieve. This should be a lower case header name. For example: "Connection"
01852     @return Value associated with the header key or null if the key did not exist in the response.
01853     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01854  */
01855 extern cchar *httpGetHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key);
01856 
01857 /** 
01858     Get all the response http headers.
01859     @description Get all the receiver headers. The returned string formats all the headers in the form:
01860         key: value\\nkey2: value2\\n...
01861     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01862     @return String containing all the headers. The caller must free this returned string.
01863     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01864  */
01865 extern char *httpGetHeaders(HttpConn *conn);
01866 
01867 /** 
01868     Get the hash table of receiver Http headers
01869     @description Get the internal hash table of receiver headers
01870     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01871     @return Hash table. See MprHash for how to access the hash table.
01872     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01873  */
01874 extern MprHashTable *httpGetHeaderHash(HttpConn *conn);
01875 
01876 /** 
01877     Get the request query string
01878     @description Get query string sent with the current request.
01879     @param conn HttpConn connection object
01880     @return String containing the request query string. Caller should not free.
01881     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01882  */
01883 extern cchar *httpGetQueryString(HttpConn *conn);
01884 
01885 /** 
01886     Get a status associated with a response to a client request.
01887     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01888     @return An integer Http response code. Typically 200 is success.
01889     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01890  */
01891 extern int httpGetStatus(HttpConn *conn);
01892 
01893 /** 
01894     Get the Http status message associated with a response to a client request. The Http status message is supplied 
01895     on the first line of the Http response.
01896     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01897     @returns A Http status message. Caller must not free.
01898     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01899  */
01900 extern char *httpGetStatusMessage(HttpConn *conn);
01901 
01902 /** 
01903     Read receiver body data. This will read available body data. If in sync mode, this call may block. If in async
01904     mode, the call will not block and will return with whatever data is available.
01905     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01906     @param buffer Buffer to receive read data
01907     @param size Size of buffer. 
01908     @return The number of bytes read
01909     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01910  */
01911 extern int httpRead(HttpConn *conn, char *buffer, int size);
01912 
01913 /** 
01914     Read response data as a string. This will read all receiver body and return a string that the caller should free. 
01915     This will block and should not be used in async mode.
01916     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
01917     @returns A string containing the receiver body. Caller should free.
01918     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01919  */
01920 extern char *httpReadString(HttpConn *conn);
01921 
01922 /* Internal */
01923 extern HttpReceiver *httpCreateReceiver(HttpConn *conn);
01924 extern void httpDestroyReceiver(HttpConn *conn);
01925 extern bool httpContentNotModified(HttpConn *conn);
01926 extern HttpRange *httpCreateRange(HttpConn *conn, int start, int end);
01927 extern void  httpConnError(struct HttpConn *conn, int status, cchar *fmt, ...);
01928 extern void  httpProcessReadEvent(HttpConn *conn, HttpPacket *packet);
01929 extern void  httpProcessWriteEvent(HttpConn *conn);
01930 extern bool  httpProcessCompletion(HttpConn *conn);
01931 extern int   httpSetUri(HttpConn *conn, cchar *newUri);
01932 extern void  httpSetEtag(HttpConn *conn, MprPath *info);

01942 extern void httpAddVars(HttpConn *conn, cchar *buf, int len);

01959 extern int httpCompareFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var, cchar *value);

01968 extern cchar *httpGetCookies(HttpConn *conn);

01970 /**
01971     Get a form variable
01972     @description Get the value of a named form variable. Form variables are define via www-urlencoded query or post
01973         data contained in the request.
01974     @param conn HttpConn connection object
01975     @param var Name of the form variable to retrieve
01976     @param defaultValue Default value to return if the variable is not defined. Can be null.
01977     @return String containing the form variable's value. Caller should not free.
01978     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01979  */
01980 extern cchar *httpGetFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var, cchar *defaultValue);
01981 
01982 /**
01983     Get a form variable as an integer
01984     @description Get the value of a named form variable as an integer. Form variables are define via 
01985         www-urlencoded query or post data contained in the request.

01987     @param var Name of the form variable to retrieve
01988     @param defaultValue Default value to return if the variable is not defined. Can be null.
01989     @return Integer containing the form variable's value
01990     @ingroup HttpReceiver
01991  */
01992 extern int httpGetIntFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var, int defaultValue);
01993 
01994 /**
01995     Get the request query string

02000  */
02001 extern cchar *httpGetQueryString(HttpConn *conn);

02006         www-urlencoded query or post data contained in the request.

02008     @param var Name of the form variable to retrieve
02009     @param value Default value to return if the variable is not defined. Can be null.

02011  */
02012 extern void httpSetIntFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var, int value);

02017         www-urlencoded query or post data contained in the request.

02019     @param var Name of the form variable to retrieve
02020     @param value Default value to return if the variable is not defined. Can be null.
02021     @ingroup HttpReceiver
02022  */
02023 extern void httpSetFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var, cchar *value);

02026     Test if a form variable is defined

02032 extern int httpTestFormVar(HttpConn *conn, cchar *var);
