02034 extern void httpCreateEnvVars(HttpConn *conn);
02035 
02036 /*  
02037     Transmitter flags
02038  */
02039 #define HTTP_TRANS_DONT_CACHE          0x1     /**< Add no-cache to the transmission */
02040 #define HTTP_TRANS_NO_BODY             0x2     /**< No transmission body, only sent headers */
02041 #define HTTP_TRANS_HEADERS_CREATED     0x4     /**< Response headers have been created */
02042 
02043 /** 
02044     Http Transmitter
02045     @description The transmitter object controls the transmission of data. This may be client requests or responses to
02046         client requests. Most of the APIs in the Response group still take a HttpConn object as their first parameter. 
02047         This is to make the API easier to remember - APIs take a connection object rather than a receiver or 
02048         transmission object.
02049     @stability Evolving
02050     @defgroup HttpTransmitter HttpTransmitter
02051     @see HttpTransmitter HttpReceiver HttpConn httpSetCookie httpError httpFormatBody
02052  */
02053 typedef struct HttpTransmitter {
02054     struct HttpConn *conn;                  /**< Current connection object */
02055     MprList         *outputPipeline;        /**< Output processing */
02056     HttpStage       *handler;               /**< Server-side request handler stage */
02057     HttpStage       *connector;             /**< Network connector to send / receive socket data */
02058     HttpPacket      *freePackets;           /**< List of free packets */
02059     MprHashTable    *headers;               /**< Custom transmission headers */
02060     HttpQueue       queue[2];               /**< Dummy head for the queues */
02061 
02062     HttpUri         *parsedUri;             /**< Request uri. Only used for requests */
02063     HttpRange       *currentRange;          /**< Current range being fullfilled */
02064     char            *rangeBoundary;         /**< Inter-range boundary */
02065 
02066     void            *handlerData;           /**< Data reserved for the handler */
02067     char            *etag;                  /**< Unique identifier tag */
02068     char            *header;                /**< HTTP transmission header */
02069     char            *method;                /**< Request method GET, HEAD, POST, DELETE, OPTIONS, PUT, TRACE */
02070     cchar           *mimeType;              /**< Mime type of the transmission document */
02071     char            *altBody;               /**< Alternate transmission for errors */
02072     int             chunkSize;              /**< Chunk size to use when using transfer encoding. Zero for unchunked. */
02073     int             flags;                  /**< Response flags */
02074     int             finalized;              /**< Finalization done */
02075     int             length;                 /**< Transmission content length */
02076     int             pos;                    /**< Current I/O position */
02077     int             status;                 /**< HTTP response status */
02078     int             writeComplete;          /**< All write data has been sent */
02079 
02080     /* 
02081        File information for file based handlers
02082      */
02083     MprFile         *file;                  /**< File to be served */
02084     MprPath         fileInfo;               /**< File information if there is a real file to serve */
02085     char            *filename;              /**< Name of a real file being served */
02086     cchar           *extension;             /**< Filename extension */
02087     int             entityLength;           /**< Original content length before range subsetting */
02088     int             bytesWritten;           /**< Bytes written including headers */
02089     int             headerSize;             /**< Size of the header written */
02090 
02091     //  TODO -- rationalize with chunkSize
02092     int             chunked;
02093 } HttpTransmitter;
02094 
02095 /** 
02096     Add a header to the transmission using a format string.
02097     @description Add a header if it does not already exits.
02098     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02099     @param key Http response header key
02100     @param fmt Printf style formatted string to use as the header key value
02101     @param ... Arguments for fmt
02102     @return Zero if successful, otherwise a negative MPR error code. Returns MPR_ERR_ALREADY_EXISTS if the header already
02103         exists.
02104     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02105  */
02106 extern void httpAddHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key, cchar *fmt, ...);
02107 
02108 /** 
02109     Add a header to the transmission
02110     @description Add a header if it does not already exits.
02111     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02112     @param key Http response header key
02113     @param value Key value to use
02114     @return Zero if successful, otherwise a negative MPR error code. Returns MPR_ERR_ALREADY_EXISTS if the header already
02115         exists.
02116     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02117  */
02118 extern void httpAddSimpleHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key, cchar *value);
02119 
02120 /** 
02121     Append a transmission header
02122     @description Set the header if it does not already exists. Append with a ", " separator if the header already exists.
02123     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02124     @param key Http response header key
02125     @param fmt Printf style formatted string to use as the header key value
02126     @param ... Arguments for fmt
02127     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02128  */
02129 extern void httpAppendHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key, cchar *fmt, ...);
02130 
02131 /** 
02132     Connect to a server and issue Http client request.
02133     @description Start a new Http request on the http object and return. This routine does not block.
02134         After starting the request, you can use httpWait() or httpWForResponse() to wait for the request to 
02135         achieve a certain state or to complete.
02136     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02137     @param method Http method to use. Valid methods include: "GET", "POST", "PUT", "DELETE", "OPTIONS" and "TRACE" 
02138     @param uri URI to fetch
02139     @return Zero if the request was successfully sent to the server. Otherwise a negative MPR error code is returned.
02140     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02141  */
02142 extern int httpConnect(HttpConn *conn, cchar *method, cchar *uri);
02143 
02144 /** 
02145     Create the transmitter object. This is used internally by the http library.
02146     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02147     @returns A transmitter object
02148  */
02149 extern HttpTransmitter *httpCreateTransmitter(HttpConn *conn);
02150 
02151 /** 
02152     Dont cache the transmission 
02153     @description Instruct the client not to cache the transmission body. This is done by setting the Cache-control Http
02154         header.
02155     @param conn HttpConn connection object
02156     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02157  */
02158 extern void httpDontCache(HttpConn *conn);
02159 
02160 /** 
02161     Enable Multipart-Mime File Upload for this request. This will define a "Content-Type: multipart/form-data..."
02162     header and will create a mime content boundary for use to delimit the various upload content files and fields.
02163     @param conn HttpConn connection object
02164     @ingroup HttpConn
02165  */
02166 extern void httpEnableUpload(HttpConn *conn);
02167 
02168 /** 
02169     Finalize transmission of the http request
02170     @description Finalize writing Http data by writing the final chunk trailer if required. If using chunked transfers, 
02171     a null chunk trailer is required to signify the end of write data. 
02172     @param conn HttpConn connection object
02173     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02174  */
02175 extern void httpFinalize(HttpConn *conn);
02176 
02177 /**
02178     Flush transmitter data. This attempts to write transmission data. If in async mode, this call will not block and
02179     may return before writing all data.
02180     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02181  */
02182 void httpFlush(HttpConn *conn);
02183 
02184 /** 
02185     Follow redirctions
02186     @description Enabling follow redirects enables the Http service to transparently follow 301 and 302 redirections
02187         and fetch the redirected URI.
02188     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02189     @param follow Set to true to enable transparent redirections
02190     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02191  */
02192 extern void httpFollowRedirects(HttpConn *conn, bool follow);
02193 
02194 /** 
02195     Format an alternate transmission body
02196     @description Format a transmission body to use instead of data generated by the request processing pipeline.
02197     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02198     @param title Title string to format into the HTML transmission body.
02199     @param fmt Printf style formatted string. This string may contain HTML tags and is not HTML encoded before
02200         sending to the user. NOTE: Do not send user input back to the client using this method. Otherwise you open
02201         large security holes.
02202     @param ... Arguments for fmt
02203     @return A count of the number of bytes in the transmission body.
02204     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02205  */
02206 extern int httpFormatBody(HttpConn *conn, cchar *title, cchar *fmt, ...);
02207 
02208 /** 
02209     Format an error transmission
02210     @description Format an error message to use instead of data generated by the request processing pipeline.
02211         This is typically used to send errors and redirections.
02212     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02213     @param status Http response status code
02214     @param fmt Printf style formatted string. This string may contain HTML tags and is not HTML encoded before
02215         sending to the user. NOTE: Do not send user input back to the client using this method. Otherwise you open
02216         large security holes.
02217     @param args Arguments for fmt
02218     @return A count of the number of bytes in the transmission body.
02219     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02220  */
02221 extern int httpFormatError(HttpConn *conn, int status, cchar *fmt, va_list args);
02222 
02223 /**
02224     Get if chunked transfer encoding is used for the transmission
02225     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02226     @return True if chunked encoding is used
02227  */
02228 extern int httpGetChunked(HttpConn *conn);
02229 
02230 /**
02231     Get the queue data for the connection
02232     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02233     @return the private queue data object
02234  */
02235 extern void *httpGetQueueData(HttpConn *conn);
02236 
02237 /** 
02238     Return whether transfer chunked encoding will be used on this request
02239     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02240     @returns true if chunk encoding will be used
02241     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02242  */ 
02243 extern int httpIsChunked(HttpConn *conn);
02244 
02245 /** 
02246     Determine if the transmission needs a transparent retry to implement authentication or redirection. This is used
02247     by client requests. If authentication is required, a request must first be tried once to receive some authentication 
02248     key information that must be resubmitted to gain access.
02249     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02250     @param url Reference to a string to receive a redirection URL. Set to NULL if not redirection is required.
02251     @return true if the request needs to be retried.
02252     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02253  */
02254 extern bool httpNeedRetry(HttpConn *conn, char **url);
02255 
02256 /**
02257     Tell the transmitter to omit sending any body
02258     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02259  */
02260 extern void httpOmitBody(HttpConn *conn);
02261 
02262 /** 
02263     Redirect the client
02264     @description Redirect the client to a new uri.
02265     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02266     @param status Http status code to send with the response
02267     @param uri New uri for the client
02268     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02269  */
02270 extern void httpRedirect(HttpConn *conn, int status, cchar *uri);
02271 
02272 /** 
02273     Set whether transfer chunked encoding will be used on this request. If enabled, a "Transfer-Encoding: Chunked" will
02274     be added to the request headers and all write data will be delimited by chunk specifications.
02275     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02276     @param enable Set to true to enable transfer chunk encoding.
02277     @returns Zero if successful. Otherwise returns a negative MPR error code.
02278     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02279  */ 
02280 extern int httpSetChunked(HttpConn *conn, int enable);
02281 
02282 /** 
02283     Define a content length header in the transmission. This will define a "Content-Length: NNN" request header.
02284     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02285     @param length Numeric value for the content length header.
02286     @ingroup HttpConn
02287  */
02288 extern void httpSetContentLength(HttpConn *conn, int length);
02289 
02290 /** 
02291     Set a transmission cookie
02292     @description Define a cookie to send in the transmission Http header
02293     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02294     @param name Cookie name
02295     @param value Cookie value
02296     @param path URI path to which the cookie applies
02297     @param domain Domain in which the cookie applies. Must have 2-3 dots.
02298     @param lifetime Duration for the cookie to persist in seconds
02299     @param secure Set to true if the cookie only applies for SSL based connections
02300     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02301  */
02302 extern void httpSetCookie(HttpConn *conn, cchar *name, cchar *value, cchar *path, cchar *domain, int lifetime, bool secure);
02303 
02304 /**
02305     Define the length of the transmission content. When a static content is used for the transmission body, defining
02306     the entity length permits the request pipeline to know when all the data has been sent.
02307     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02308     @param len Transmission body length in bytes
02309  */
02310 extern void httpSetEntityLength(HttpConn *conn, int len);
02311 
02312 /** 
02313     Set a transmission header
02314     @description Set a Http header to send with the request. If the header already exists, it its value is overwritten.
02315     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02316     @param key Http response header key
02317     @param fmt Printf style formatted string to use as the header key value
02318     @param ... Arguments for fmt
02319     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02320  */
02321 extern void httpSetHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key, cchar *fmt, ...);
02322 
02323 /** 
02324     Set a Http response status.
02325     @description Set the Http response status for the request. This defaults to 200 (OK).
02326     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02327     @param status Http status code.
02328     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02329  */
02330 extern void httpSetStatus(HttpConn *conn, int status);
02331 
02332 /** 
02333     Set the transmission (response)  mime type
02334     @description Set the mime type Http header in the transmission
02335     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02336     @param mimeType Mime type string
02337     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02338  */
02339 extern void httpSetMimeType(HttpConn *conn, cchar *mimeType);
02340 
02341 /** 
02342     Set a simple key/value transmission header
02343     @description Set a Http header to send with the request. If the header already exists, it its value is overwritten.
02344     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02345     @param key Http response header key
02346     @param value String value for the key
02347     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02348 */
02349 extern void httpSetSimpleHeader(HttpConn *conn, cchar *key, cchar *value);
02350 
02351 /** 
02352     Wait for the connection to achieve the requested state Used for blocking client requests.
02353     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02354     @param state HTTP_STATE_XXX to wait for.
02355     @param timeout Timeout in milliseconds to wait 
02356     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02357  */
02358 extern int httpWait(HttpConn *conn, int state, int timeout);
02359 
02360 /** 
02361     Write the transmission headers
02362     @description Write the Http transmission headers into the given packet. This should only be called by connectors
02363         just prior to sending output to the client. It should be delayed as long as possible if the content length is
02364         not yet known to give the pipeline a chance to determine the transmission length. This way, a non-chunked 
02365         transmission can be sent with a content-length header. This is the fastest HTTP transmission.
02366     @param conn HttpConn connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02367     @param packet Packet into which to place the headers
02368     @ingroup HttpTransmitter
02369  */
02370 extern void httpWriteHeaders(HttpConn *conn, HttpPacket *packet);
02371 
02372 /** 
02373     Write Http upload body data
02374     @description Write files and form fields as request body data. This will use transfer chunk encoding. This routine 
02375         will block until all the buffer is written even if a callback is defined.
02376     @param conn Http connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02377     @param fileData List of string file names to upload
02378     @param formData List of strings containing "key=value" pairs. The form data should be already www-urlencoded.
02379     @return Number of bytes successfully written.
02380     @ingroup HttpConn
02381  */
02382 extern int httpWriteUploadData(HttpConn *conn, MprList *formData, MprList *fileData);
02383 
02384 /**
02385     Indicate that the transmission socket is blocked
02386     @param conn Http connection object created via $httpCreateConn
02387  */
02388 extern void httpWriteBlocked(HttpConn *conn);
02389 
02390 /** 
02391     Server endpoint
02392     @stability Evolving
02393     @defgroup HttpServer HttpServer
02394     @see HttpServer httpCreateServer httpStartServer httpStopServer
02395  */
02396 typedef struct  HttpServer {
02397     Http            *http;                  /**< Http service object */
02398     MprWaitHandler  waitHandler;            /**< I/O wait handler */
02399     char            *serverRoot;            /**< Directory for server configuration */
02400     char            *documentRoot;          /**< Directory for documents */
02401     char            *name;                  /**< ServerName */
02402     char            *ip;                    /**< Listen IP address */
02403     int             port;                   /**< Listen port */
02404     int             async;                  /**< Listening is in async mode (non-blocking) */
02405     void            *context;               /**< Embedding context */
02406     MprSocket       *sock;                  /**< Listening socket */
02407     MprDispatcher   *dispatcher;            /**< Event dispatcher */
02408     HttpNotifier    notifier;               /**< Http state change notification callback */
02409     struct MprSsl   *ssl;                   /**< Server SSL configuration */
02410 } HttpServer;
02411 
02412 #define HTTP_NOTIFY(conn, state, flags) \
02413     if (conn->notifier) { \
02414         (conn->notifier)(conn, state, flags); \
02415     } else
02416 
02417 /** 
02418     Create a server endpoint.
02419     @description Creates a listening server on the given IP:PORT. Use httpStartServer to begin listening for client
02420         connections.
02421     @param http Http object created via #httpCreate
02422     @param ip IP address on which to listen
02423     @param port IP port number
02424     @param dispatcher Dispatcher to use. Can be null.
02425     @ingroup HttpServer
02426  */
02427 extern HttpServer *httpCreateServer(Http *http, cchar *ip, int port, MprDispatcher *dispatcher);
02428 
02429 /** 
02430     Define a notifier callback for this server.
02431     @description The notifier callback will be invoked as Http requests are processed.
02432     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02433     @param fn Notifier function. 
02434     @ingroup HttpConn
02435  */
02436 extern void httpSetServerNotifier(HttpServer *server, HttpNotifier fn);
02437 
02438 /** 
02439     Start listening for client connections.
02440     @description Opens the server socket and starts listening for connections.
02441     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02442     @returns Zero if successful, otherwise a negative MPR error code.
02443     @ingroup HttpServer
02444  */
02445 extern int httpStartServer(HttpServer *server);
02446 
02447 /** 
02448     Stop the server listening for client connections.
02449     @description Closes the server socket endpoint.
02450     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02451     @ingroup HttpServer
02452  */
02453 extern void httpStopServer(HttpServer *server);
02454 
02455 /**
02456     Get if the server is running in asynchronous mode
02457     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02458     @return True if the server is in async mode
02459  */
02460 extern int httpGetServerAsync(HttpServer *server);
02461 
02462 /**
02463     Control if the server is running in asynchronous mode
02464     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02465     @param enable Set to 1 to enable async mode.
02466  */
02467 extern void httpSetServerAsync(HttpServer *server, int enable);
02468 
02469 /**
02470     Get the server context object
02471     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02472     @return The server context object defined via httpSetServerContext
02473  */
02474 extern void *httpGetServerContext(HttpServer *server);
02475 
02476 /**
02477     Set the server context object
02478     @param server HttpServer object created via #httpCreateServer
02479     @param context New context object
02480  */
02481 extern void httpSetServerContext(HttpServer *server, void *context);
02482 
02483 #ifdef __cplusplus
02484 } /* extern C */
02485 #endif
02486 
02487 #endif /* _h_HTTP */
